business.headline: BYD overtakes Tesla in 2024 revenue, becomes World's top EV makerBYD surpassed Tesla in revenue, reporting $107 billion in 2024. The Chinese EV giant leads China's auto market, while Tesla faces declining sales, boycotts, and a falling valuation amid industry challenges.

Wall Street drifts ahead of report on US consumer confidenceWall Street saw marginal gains on Tuesday after making gains a day earlier in hopes of the Trump administration potentially softening its next set of tariffs.
ATM cash withdrawals to get costlier from May 1. Here's whyThe Reserve Bank of India has approved a hike in ATM interchange fees, raising cash withdrawal costs for customers from May 1, 2025.

Government drops import duty on key parts for EV batteries, phonesFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the government will exempt import duty on 35 items used to make EV batteries and 28 items used in mobile phone manufacturing.

Sensex, Nifty erase gains to close flat amid tariff uncertainty; Zomato down 6%The S&P BSE Sensex closed just 32.81 points above at 78,017.19 after having gained nearly 700 points in the day. Nifty also followed a similar pattern as it ended with just a 10.30 point gain at 23,668.65.

Air India staff to fly economy as airline tackles passenger concerns: ReportThe move is part of Air India's effort to improve its service and customer experience, following criticism over frequent flight delays.

India open to tariff cuts on US imports worth $23 billion: ReportThe government is trying to reduce the impact of US President Donald Trump's global reciprocal tariffs, which are set to take effect from April 2.
What is Google tax that India is likely to scrap from April 1?The tax is expected to be scrapped from April 1, 2025, as part of amendments to the Finance Bill.

Sensex down over 700 points from day's high. Why stock market turned volatile?Stock market today: At around 11:45 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 51.05 points to 77,933.33 and the NSE Nifty50 declined 17.85 points to trade at 23,640.50.

India likely to remove 6% Google tax from April 1, tech giants to benefitThe Equalisation Levy know as 'Google Tax' was introduced in 2016 to tax payments made by Indian businesses to foreign companies for digital advertising services.

UltraTech Cement shares surge 4% in early trade today. Here's whyGlobal brokerage firm UBS has shared a fresh view on India's cement sector and upgraded stocks such as UltraTech Cement and Ambuja Cement.
Sensex jumps 700 points in early trade. 5 key things to know todayThe S&P BSE was up 739.51 points to 78,723.89 at 10.01 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 196 points to 23,854.35.

entertainment.headline: Final Destination Bloodlines trailer: Death is back to claim lives once againThe Final Destination saga will continue with Bloodlines, the trailer of which was released today, March 25. The film will once again bring back Death and his inventive ways of killing people.

Pedro Pascal on a 5-year leap in The Last of Us Season 2: Incredibly comfortingDuring a press conference, Pedro Pascal shared insights on the emotional challenges of returning to The Last of Us for its second season. He discussed his mindset and the evolving relationship with co-star Bella Ramsey.

Kim Sae-ron's ex-boyfriend denies Kim Soo-hyun's involvement in her deathKim Sae-ron's ex-boyfriend has denied Kim Soo-hyun's involvement in her death, alleging abuse in her marriage. The actress's secret marriage and alleged emotional distress are under scrutiny.

Arjun Kapoor remembers mother Mona on 13th death anniversary: Love you, alwaysActor Arjun Kapoor remembers his mother, Mona Shourie Kapoor, on the 13th anniversary of her passing. He shares an emotional tribute, reflecting on her enduring influence and the pain of her absence.

Tamil actor-director Manoj Bharathiraja dies at 48 in ChennaiTamil actor and director Manoj Bharathiraja, son of legendary director Bharathiraja, died at his Chetpet residence in Chennai on March 25. He was 48 years old.
George Clooney is done with romantic filmsHollywood star George Clooney is no longer in the mood to make any romantic films. The veteran actor said he doesn't want to compete with younger actors.

Tony Kakkar defends Neha Kakkar after Melbourne concert delaySinger Tony Kakkar defended sister Neha Kakkar after she arrived three hours late to her Melbourne concert. He blamed the organisers for the delay.

Solo Leveling 2: Sung Jinwoo-Ant King Beru clash makes episode 12 a visual treatThe 12th episode of Solo Leveling aired on Saturday, thrilling fans with an intense battle scene as Sung Jinwoo clashed with Ant King Beru on Jeju Island. Was it the best Solo Leveling episode so far? Read on to know.

Reema Kagti on rising star salaries: Pressure on budgets is ridiculousReema Kagti spoke out about the unsustainable pressure rising star salaries are placing on film budgets, while also highlighting the issue of pay disparity between male and female actors.

Adolescence, brilliance of British crime shows, and why US is losing the genre warWith 'Adolescence' winning all over, it is the right time to discuss why British crime dramas are built to last as compared to the ones made in the US in the same genre.

Test trailer: Nayanthara, R Madhavan's dreams get intertwined in upcoming thrillerNetflix has unveiled the trailer for 'Test', a Tamil film directed by S Sashikanth. The film follows a cricketer, scientist, and teacher as they face personal and professional challenges, premiering on Netflix April 4.

Pooja Hegde on PR and online hate: People are spending lakhs to troll meActor Pooja Hegde opened up about being targeted by online trolls, revealing that paid campaigns were run against her. She called the extent of trolling 'bizarre', and shared how it affected her family.

Exclusive: The Yellow Diary's Himonshu Parikh on solo EP Circles, band membersHimonshu Parikh of The Yellow Diary steps into solo territory with his debut EP Circles, capturing the essence of love's cyclical journey. Supported by his bandmates, the EP blends personal experiences with a collaborative spirit, resonating deeply with listeners.

Sonu Nigam faces stone pelting during Delhi University performanceSinger Sonu Nigam's performance at the Delhi Technological University was recently disrupted after he was attacked with stones and bottles.
Comedienne Nikki Glaser weighs in on Ozempic usageComedienne Nikki Glaser has voiced her support for Ozempic as a weight-loss aid, challenging the stigma surrounding its use.

Aarya Babbar reacts to Prateik dropping his surname: You can't change your identityPrateik Babbar's half-brother Aarya Babbar spoke about the actor dropping his father's legacy and adopting his mother's name. Aarya stated that one cannot erase their identity.

Empuraan pre-sales hit Rs 58 crore, Mohanlal's film set for historic openingMalayalam superstar Mohanlal's L2: Empuraan has already grossed Rs 58 crore worldwide in its advance sales. As the film will release on March 27, the film could turn out to be the biggest offering from Malayalam cinema.

Karan Kundrra: I am only a Laughter Chef, can't compete with MasterChef TejasswiKaran Kundrra returns to Laughter Chef 2, discussing the show's impact on normalising men cooking and his reluctance to compete with girlfriend Tejasswi Prakash, who is a participant in the current season of MasterChef, in the kitchen.

Jr NTR reflects on RRR journey as the film marks three yearsAs RRR marks three years, Jr NTR opened up about his transformative journey to portray Komaram Bheem. The actor also shared insights on his collaboration with director SS Rajamouli and the challenges he faced.

general news.headline: Supreme Court takes note of High Court's 'grabbing breasts not rape' orderThe Supreme Court will on Wednesday hear the matter of Allahabad High Court's recent ruling that grabbing breasts and breaking pyjama strings wasn't an attempt to rape.

Festival of rumours, says Muhammad Yunus amid Bangladesh coup buzzMuhammad Yunus said that attempts are being made to "destabilise the country". His remarks came as reports of a probable coup in Bangaldesh emerged.

AIADMK leader, Amit Shah meet: Patch-up with BJP ahead of 2026 Tamil Nadu polls?Union Home Minister Amit Shah met Tamil Nadu leader of Opposition and AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami in Delhi today. Their meeting has sparked speculation of the BJP reuniting with AIADMK ahead of the 2026 Tamil Nadu elections.

Kunal Kamra takes on Shiv Sena with new song after Mumbai studio vandalismKunal Kamra, who is under attack by Shiv Sena for mocking Eknath Shinde, upped the ante against the ruling coalition with a new video.

Cops sleep near PCR vehicle as man murdered metres away in AhmedabadA viral video from Ahmedabad shows policemen sleeping in a parked PCR vehicle while a murder was taking place nearby. A probe has been launched against the cops.

India, China discuss cross-border cooperation, Kailash-Mansarovar YatraA key focus of the India-China talks in Beijing was restarting cross-border cooperation, particularly on trans-border rivers and the Kailash-Mansarovar Yatra.

Another case against 'Yashu Yashu' pastor, this time over thrashing man, womanSelf-styled Christian prophet Bajinder Singh, who is accused of sexual harassment, is in fresh trouble over a video of him thrashing two people. An assault and criminal intimidation case has been filed against him.

Ranya Rao's 'confession' in gold smuggling case: Money sent through hawalaAnti-smuggling agency DRI told a court that Kannada actor Ranya Rao, arrested in a gold-smuggling case, had confessed to transferring funds via hawala for purchasing gold.

Ukraine, Russia have agreed on Black Sea ceasefire: White HouseIn parallel statements, the White House said that Ukraine and Russia "agreed to ensure safe navigation, eliminate the use of force and prevent the use of commercial vessels for military purposes in the Black Sea.

Is a political storm brewing in Bangladesh? Explained in 5 pointsProtesting students who ousted PM Sheikh Hasina from power have formed a political party, radical extremists are marching on the streets, the Yunus government seems to have lost the plot, and there are reports of heightened military activity. Is a political storm brewing in Bangladesh? These five points will provide clarity.

Video: Boxer Saweety Boora assaults husband Deepak Hooda inside police stationIn a video that has gone viral, boxer Saweety Boora has been seen assaulting Kabaddi player Deepak Niwas Hooda inside a police station in Hisar, Haryana. The incident took place on March 15.

Will make announcement soon: MK Stalin to take action against Hindi impositionTamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin reaffirmed the state's commitment to the two-language policy, rejecting Hindi imposition and financial conditions tied to it. He accused the Centre of cultural dominance and vowed concrete steps to protect Tamil identity.

BJP renews Bofors attack on Gandhis, cites explosive claims from new bookCiting a new book on Bofors, the BJP sought the resignations of Sonia and Rahul Gandhi as Members of Parliament. The book allegedly exposes Congress's ties with Italian middleman Quattrocchi.

BJP's 'Saugat-e-Modi' Eid kits to benefit 32 lakh MuslimsThe BJP today launched the 'Saugat-e-Modi' initiative, which is expected to benefit 32 lakh underprivileged Muslims, who would receive special kits to celebrate Eid.

She also asked the director, with whom she collaborated with in Simran, to stay out of her matters.

James Bond franchise gets new producers: Amy Pascal & David Heyman take chargeAmazon MGM has appointed Amy Pascal and David Heyman as the next James Bond film's producers, marking a major shift from the Broccoli family's decades-long leadership. PBKS secured an 11-run victory over Gujarat Titans in a high-scoring thriller on Tuesday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
